items.title: CVE-2026-26198
items.key_takeaway: Ormar versions 0.9.9‑0.22.0 allow raw SQL injection via min()/max() aggregate calls; upgrade to ≥0.23.0 immediately to prevent database compromise.

items.title: CVE-2026-26331
items.key_takeaway: yt-dlp versions prior to 2026.02.21 allow command injection via the --netrc-cmd option; upgrade to ≥2026.02.21 or avoid using this option.

items.title: CVE-2026-27952
items.key_takeaway: Agenta-API versions before 0.48.1 permit sandbox escape through a whitelisted numpy module, enabling arbitrary code execution; upgrade to ≥0.48.1 or later where the issue is fixed.

items.title: CVE-2026-27966
items.key_takeaway: Langflow versions before 1.8.0 hardcode allow_dangerous_code=True in the CSV Agent node, enabling prompt injection RCE via the python_repl_ast tool; upgrade to >=1.8.0 immediately or disable the CSV Agent.

items.title: CVE-2025-69985
items.key_takeaway: FUXA ≤1.2.8 trusts the HTTP Referer header for JWT validation, allowing unauthenticated authentication bypass and arbitrary Node.js code execution; upgrade to a patched version immediately.

items.title: CVE-2026-27699
items.key_takeaway: `basic-ftp` versions before 5.2.0 allow path traversal via malicious FTP server filenames in `downloadToDir()`, potentially writing files outside the target directory; upgrade to >=5.2.0 or validate filenames.

items.title: CVE-2026-27903
items.key_takeaway: minimatch versions prior to the fixed releases can be forced into exponential backtracking by crafted glob patterns containing multiple non‑adjacent '**' segments, stalling the Node.js event loop for seconds; upgrade to >=10.2.3, 9.0.7, 8.0.6, 7.4.8, 6.2.2, 5.1.8, 4.2.5, or 3.1.3 to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27959
items.key_takeaway: Koa versions before 3.1.2 (or 2.16.4) improperly parse the Host header in `ctx.hostname`, allowing attacker‑controlled hostnames to be used in URL generation and routing, leading to host‑header injection; upgrade to the fixed releases to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27208
items.key_takeaway: bleon-ethical/api-gateway-deploy version 1.0.0 allows OS command injection and privilege escalation leading to root container escape; upgrade to >=1.0.1 which adds input sanitization, runs as non‑root user, and enforces security gates.

items.title: CVE-2026-27899
items.key_takeaway: WireGuard Portal versions before 2.1.3 allow any authenticated non-admin user to gain full admin rights by setting "IsAdmin": true in their profile update request; upgrade to v2.1.3 (or later) and ensure proper field protection to prevent privilege escalation.

items.title: CVE-2026-2794
items.key_takeaway: Firefox versions prior to 148 contain an information disclosure bug due to uninitialized memory; upgrade to Firefox 148 or later to mitigate the issue.

items.title: CVE-2026-2800
items.key_takeaway: Firefox for Android and Thunderbird versions prior to 148 have a critical WebAuthn spoofing vulnerability; upgrade to version 148 or later to protect against authentication spoofing.

items.title: CVE-2026-2634
items.key_takeaway: Firefox for iOS versions before 147.4 have a critical address‑bar spoofing vulnerability; upgrade to 147.4 or later to prevent domain spoofing attacks.

items.title: OWASP Mobile Application Security Testing Guide (MASTG)
items.key_takeaway: The OWASP Mobile Application Security Testing Guide (MASTG) offers a comprehensive, up-to-date methodology and test cases for securing iOS and Android apps, essential for security testing and secure development.

items.title: OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard (MASVS)
items.key_takeaway: MASVS provides a comprehensive set of security requirements for mobile apps, serving as a checklist for secure design, implementation, and verification across iOS and Android.

items.title: OWASP Top 10 for Web Applications
items.key_takeaway: The OWASP Top 10 provides a concise list of the most critical web application security risks, serving as a baseline for secure development, testing, and compliance.
